Near04: I hope that horse is safe.
HorseTake_Talk_011:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think_00>I wonder what's happened to that poor
horse. <sp:5:0:0>That gentle creature is not the
type to just bolt.
The horse was fond of <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>,
too, but ran away from her, and right
toward some huge monster?
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>None of this makes sense.
HorseTake_Talk_012:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Well, if I had to be certain...<sp:5:0:0>honestly, I'm
not totally sure. The snow was coming
down hard when it happened.
But even so, I'd swear it was her face.
I'd know <clr:0000>Princess Zelda <clr:ffff>anywhere, even
in a blizzard.
Ready_Talk_001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>That's the troubling part,<sp:5:0:0> isn't it...<sp:0:4:0>When it happened, I'd finished tending to
the horses and was taking a bit of rest in
the stable.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Then that gentle creature began making
terrible sounds—neighing and bucking
around so hard, it shook the stable.
HorseTake_Talk_013:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_01>That horse bolted off fast, but I do know it
<clr:0000>galloped north <clr:ffff>of here.
Ready_Talk_002:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:QuestionNormal_01>So you went outside to see what was
wrong, didn't you?
HorseTake_Talk_014:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I'd go off in search of that horse this
very moment, if it weren't for the huge
monster flying around.
I'm terribly worried. <sp:5:0:0>I hope that poor
creature is OK.
Ready_Talk_003:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Think_00>Yes, exactly...<sp:5:0:0> And there she was!
<clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>! After all this time, she
was right in front of our stable.
But then the princess came closer, and
the <clr:0000>golden horse<clr:ffff> thrashed harder.

<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_00>Then that animal broke free and bolted
away like nothing I've ever seen before.

<sp:3:0:2:0301>I couldn't help staring at that crazed
creature, and when I looked back at the
princess, she was just...<sp:5:0:0>gone.
It happened so fast.
HorseTake_Talk_015:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_01>I really should go out and search for
the poor horse.<sp:5:1:0> But what if I run into
that monster?
Besides, for all I know, that steed will get
agitated and start <clr:0000>acting wild <clr:ffff>as soon as
it sees me.
I don't have the stamina to calm down
such a strong horse. Then again, I could
always use <clr:0000>energizing elixir<clr:ffff>.
HorseTake_Talk_015_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:SurpriseS_01>Hey, now there's an idea!<sp:5:0:0> I could share
some of that with you!
Ready_Talk_004:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think>So, you lost sight of the horse, and then
<clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff> vanished on the spot.
That's all strange, from start to finish...
My little sources tipped me off about this,
but I have to say, I thought it was going
to turn out to be nothing much.
HorseTake_Talk_016:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>It has a beautiful <clr:0000>golden coat<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:0:0>


Then there's its <clr:0000>mane of honeycomb plaits<clr:ffff>
the princess braided herself.<sp:5:1:0> There's no
other horse out there that looks like it.
HorseTake_Talk_015_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Happy_00>You might know this, but to catch a wild
horse, you have to mount it, and then
soothe it before you get bucked off.
But some horses will kick and stir and
make such a fuss, they wear you down
before you can catch them.
This is where <clr:0000>energizing elixir <clr:ffff>comes in.<sp:5:1:0>
If you're trying to soothe a horse and your
stamina's nearly out, drink some.
Then you'll have the energy to soothe
any mount—even the wildest of the wild.

Oh, and if you want to know how to make
that, just stew up a <clr:0000>restless cricket <clr:ffff>with
monster parts.
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>I'm told you can get similar effects from
cooked <clr:0000>stamella shrooms <clr:ffff>too.
Ready_Talk_005:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseS_00>Hey, partner! You're here! I should've
known it was you there.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>Just look at you, tiptoeing up like this
and getting your ear in. You've got the
makings of a real reporter.
HorseTake_Talk_017:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Unconscious_01>You haven't heard? <sp:5:0:0>There's a huge
monster with three heads that's been
seen flying around up north.
They say it breathes out dangerous
plumes of frost. I doubt I'd come out
alive if I met a terror like that.
Maybe you could survive by <clr:0000>hiding from
view <clr:ffff>as soon as you got close to it.
HorseTake_Talk_015_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0401>Oh... <sp:5:0:0>Full pouch, I see.


<sp:3:0:2:0101>In that case, here. Use that to buy the
ingredients and make some yourself.
Ready_Talk_006:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Chat_00>Oh! Is this someone else from
the newspaper?
Ready_Talk_007:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>That's right—new partner, plenty of gusto,
a lot of promise.

<sp:3:0:2:0001>Would it be all right if he listens in? Now,
please, tell us anything else you can
remember. Anything at all...
Ready_Talk_008:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad_01>The part that really bothers me...<sp:5:0:0>is the
poor animal acting that way.

That horse truly loved the princess. She
rescued it and protected it. She doted
on it!
But the horse was terrified, and for the
life of me, I can't understand why.<sp:5:0:0>
Ready_Talk_009:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:SurpriseM_00><clr:0000>Princess Zelda <clr:ffff>is known far and wide
for her compassion. I can't imagine our
princess being terrifying at all.
Ready_Talk_010:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Hold on...<sp:5:0:0>I think I did catch the briefest
glimpse of the princess's face.

I thought I couldn't have seen that right,
but she had such a cold expression.

She's been full of warmth when she's
been here before. Maybe the princess was
furious that I let the horse get away.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700>I...<sp:5:0:0>I really should find that animal and
bring it back here for her.
Ready_Talk_301:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_00>Well, actually...<sp:5:0:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0401>Our beloved, missing <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>
showed up at the stable here the
other day!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>It was strange...<sp:5:0:0> The sight of her really
agitated the princess's <clr:0000>golden horse<clr:ffff>,
which we keep stabled here.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>The steed started acting wild, like it was
terrified for its life. That poor creature
bolted, and I haven't seen it since.
HorseTake_Talk_001_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal_01>So...<sp:5:1:0>seems like we've got a real hill to
climb here before we have our story.
What's our next step?<sp:5:0:0>
Ready_Talk_302:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Wait! Your horse has a<clr:0000> golden coat<clr:ffff>, just
like hers!

<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:SurpriseL_01>It can't be! <sp:5:0:0>It must be! <sp:5:1:0>That's the
princess's <clr:0000>golden horse<clr:ffff>, which has
been missing for quite some time.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>I've been worried sick, <sp:5:0:0>and now here
you've brought the horse back.
Ready_Talk_013:
<sp:3:0:2:0301>I'd go in search of that steed, but with
the <clr:0000>huge monster <clr:ffff>that's flying around up
north, it's far too dangerous for me.
The best I can do is just keep the horse's
home here in the stable nice and clean,
just in case it returns...<sp:5:0:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>*sigh* <sp:5:1:0>I just hope someone finds that
sweet creature and brings it back
here safely.
Ready_Talk_103_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Happy_01>I know this horse well, and I do believe
you're right!<sp:5:0:0>
Ready_Talk_303:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseS_01>Whoa, partner! I've barely got my beak
into the situation here, and you just roll
in with the horse?
That kind of throws me off the saddle
here in the middle of an interview,
you know what I'm saying?
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughL_00>Oh, just giving you a hard time! Besides,
these good deeds of yours just feather
my reputation. You make me proud!<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0001>But, huh... Is it just me, or has that horse
gotten kind of attached to you?
Ready_Talk_014:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:TalkPositive_00>Your story is...<sp:5:0:0>really something. Mind
going through it again, just to make sure
I have all the details right?<sp:5:0:0>
HorseTake_Talk_000_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think_01>*sigh* How could that have happened...<sp:5:1:0>
It's so troubling.
Ready_Talk_101:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseL_01>Oh! <sp:5:0:0>Look who's finally back home!<sp:5:1:0>


No doubt about it! <sp:5:1:0>That is <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff>'s steed for certain!

<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy_00>I've been worried sick, <sp:5:0:0>but now you've
found it!
Ready_Talk_304:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>What's strange is that when <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda <clr:ffff>appeared here, <sp:5:0:0>this gentle creature
ran off in a frenzy, as if terrified.
<sp:3:0:2:0101>But for some reason, the princess's horse
really does seem to trust you.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Now that I think about it, I can't believe
that horse ran away at the sight of
<clr:0000>Princess<clr:ffff> <clr:0000>Zelda<clr:ffff>.
Could it be that wasn't the princess?
I'd know her face anywhere, but it was
snowing hard. Maybe...<sp:5:0:0>I have it wrong.
Ready_Talk_015:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:TalkPositive_01>Sure, no problem...<sp:5:1:0> We've been taking
care of a very rare animal for <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff>—a <clr:0000>golden horse<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>But the poor thing ran away from
our stable.
Ready_Talk_102:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM_00>Huh, when did you...<sp:5:0:0> Oh, never mind.


<sp:3:0:2:0901>So, partner,<sp:5:0:0> when you show up and save
the day in the middle of my reporting
work here...
Well, it kind of throws me off my saddle,
you know what I'm saying?

<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughL_00>Oh, just giving you a hard time!<sp:5:1:0> Besides,
those good deeds of yours just feather
my reputation. <sp:5:0:0>You make me proud!<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0501>But, huh... Is it just me, or has that
misplaced pony there gotten kind of
attached to you?
HorseTake_Talk_201:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>You might still be a rookie, but you're
every bit as good of a reporter as I
thought you'd be.
Thanks to you, I'll have the full story
when I write my article!
Ready_Talk_016:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think_00>Hmm...<sp:5:0:0><clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>'s horse vanishing
like that is a pretty big story. But tell me
again—why'd that horse run off?
Ready_Talk_103:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Really... <sp:5:0:0>You'd be doing me a favor if you
kept this gentle creature.

Princess Zelda asked me to find someone
who'd take good care of it.

<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_00>And in your travels around Hyrule,
perhaps you'll even have a chance to
reunite this horse with the princess.
HorseTake_Talk_202:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughL_01>All right. I'm off to the office to write up
this whole piece for the paper.<sp:5:0:0>

Take care, partner. Let's work together
again soon.
Ready_Talk_017:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Think_01>But that poor horse <clr:0000>galloped north<clr:ffff> and
never looked back.
Ready_Talk_104:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS_00>If that's the case, partner, then how
could you say no to keeping it? Do it
as a favor for the horse, at least.
HorseTake_Talk_001:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think>Let's review the facts... The horse at the
heart of all this should be fond of <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff>, right?
Yet, the animal bolted as if scared of her?
Very strange.
Ready_Talk_105:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_00>These are a <clr:0000>bridle <clr:ffff>and a <clr:0000>saddle <clr:ffff><sp:5:0:0>left
behind by Princess Zelda.

<sp:3:0:2:0101>The little one's accustomed to those,<sp:5:0:0> so
feel free to use them.
HorseTake_Talk_011_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad>That horse trusted <clr:0000>Princess Zelda <clr:ffff>like no
one else. Why did it run away as if it was
scared of her?
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I just can't wrap my head around this...
Ready_Talk_107: <sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice_00>Wait, I want you to have this too.
Ready_Talk_109:
<snd:TalkPositive_01>I'd thought of using this energizing elixir
if I had to help calm the horse after it
bolted off...
But I don't need that anymore, so I'll
give it to you.
Ready_Talk_110:
<snd:TalkPositive_01>I'd planned on using those rupees for
energizing-elixir ingredients, in case I had
to try to calm the horse in its state.
But I don't need that elixir now, so just
take the rupees as a reward.
